cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 190 mi E of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving generally west and expected to turn WSW, heading for a South-Texas landfall then inland across northern Mexico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: between Baffin Bay and Mesquite Bay, TX (near Corpus Christi)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impacts confined to south and portions of upper Texas coast; only indirect swells and rain extend toward Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with only a slight (≤3%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force (≥34 kt) winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; surge values along Louisiana coast remain below 2 ft
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands could bring 3–5 inches with isolated higher pockets over southeast Louisiana, including Plaquemines Parish
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased surf, dangerous rip currents, and a low (overnight) tornado risk in outer rain-bands
